p: The guanosine analog ribavirin is a broad-spectrum antiviral agent with activity against RSV and other RNA viruses such as hepatitis C and Zika viruses ( Antonini et al., 2018; Kim et al., 2018; Zhurilo et al., 2018). The beneficial effect of this drug in inhibiting RSV replication was demonstrated in several studies. Ribavirin showed antiviral activity against RSV and reduced RSV lung titers in infected cotton rats ( Bonavia et al., 2011). Similarly, significant clinical benefits have been observed in children treated with aerosolized ribavirin early in infection ( Devincenzo, 2000). However, the clinical application of ribavirin is limited because of its nonspecific anti-RSV activity, risks for potential toxicity, and relatively high cost ( Sun et al., 2013).
